oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Suppression of Neutrophil Function in Bovine Respiratory Disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roth, James
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: suppress of neutrophil function
neutrophil function
stress
nonbacterial infection
economic losses
bovine respiratory disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The hypothesis for its pathogenesis is that it requires three things- stress, plus a nonbacterial infection, and these two components suppress the host defense mechanism sufficiently to allow the bacterial infections to produce a severe pneumonia. And the economic losses are primarily due to the bacterial infection. This talk is going to focus on neutrophil function primarily, and I will talk about how each of those things can suppress neutrophil function.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1984; 184-187
